name: Ethics, Genetics and Reproduction
description: An intermediate-level study of moral and legal problems, including the ontological and moral status of the human embryo and fetus; human newborn, carrier and prenatal genetic screening for genetic defect, genetic therapy; the reproductive technologies (e.g., artificial insemination, in vitro fertilization); recent legislative proposals and judicial decisions.
prerequisites: PHL281H1, 7.5 courses (in any field) with at least 1.5 in philosophy
